conclusion: Determine the time t for light to travel from point O to AB boundary of transparent body ABDE with refractive index sqrt(2).
Light starts at point O and travels to AB boundary with angle of incidence 45 degrees.
Refractive index of the material is n = sqrt(2).
Snell's Law states n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2).
Using Snell's Law, sin(theta2) = 1/2, giving theta2 = 30 degrees.
Distance d is hypotenuse of right triangle with angles 45 and 30 degrees.
Horizontal component of distance is x = d cos 45 degrees.
Vertical component of distance is y = d sin 45 degrees.
Speed of light in material is v = c/sqrt(2).
Time to travel horizontal distance is t_horizontal = x/v.
Time to travel vertical distance is t_vertical = y/v.
Total time t = t_horizontal + t_vertical = d/c.
Final answer is t = d/c, expressed in terms of distance and speed of light.
